bioghist.p: Henry A. Pilsbry, the Dean of American Malacologists, was associated with the Academy of Natural Sciences for 70 years. Conservator, curator and head of the Department of Shells, he was also the internationally recognized authority in the field of land Mollusca. He wrote and edited many volumes of the Manual of Conchology and from 1889 until his death was an editor of the journal Nautilus, which he founded. A member of many scientific expeditions all over the United States, to the Caribbean, South America, Mexico, Hawaii, and other Pacific Islands, and to Australia. Few scientists have so voluminous a list of publications.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of professional papers of H.A. Pilsbry. Materials include: correspondence, 1890-1957, largely related to specimen identification and exchange and taxonomy; manuscripts and galley proofs of articles and books, with illustrations and photographs; subject files on various species, with extracts from printed sources, illustrations, and photographs; and Pilsbry's index card file of species. The collection also includes audio recordings of Pilsbry and H.G. Richards talks; a film of Strombus goliath crawling, Brazil, 1965; and a small number of photographs of Pilsbry.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
